# Revolutionaries
[color=#999999][italic]"Viva la revolución!!"[/italic][/color]
Revolutionaries are [bold]conversion antagonists[/bold] sponsored by the [color=#ff0000]Syndicate[/color]. They have no secret weapons, no hidden tricks-only [italic]a cause[/italic] and [bold]strength in numbers[/bold]. Your purpose is not to destroy the station, but to [italic]seize control of it[/italic].
## Objectives Your main goal is to [color=cyan]convert[/color], [color=yellow]cuff[/color], or [color=red]kill[/color] all of the [textlink="Command staff" link="Command"] and [color=#cb0000]Security[/color]. These roles form the backbone of station authority, and they are always protected by [color=cyan]mindshield implants[/color].
[bold]Converting command and/or security is critical for success.[/bold] Converted command/security can play key roles in empowering your revolution.
The revolution also fails if all [bold][color=#5e9cff]Head Revolutionaries[/color][/bold] are killed. In that case, every [color=red]Revolutionary[/color] deconverts immediately.
## Head Revolutionaries At the start of the shift, several crew are chosen as [bold][color=#5e9cff]Head Revolutionaries[/color][/bold]. They begin with a [color=cyan]flash[/color] and a pair of [color=cyan]sunglasses[/color].
### Conversion - To convert, hit someone with a [bold]flash[/bold] on [color=red]harm mode[/color]. - [bold]Conversion fails if the target either has [color=cyan]flash protection[/color][/bold] (such as sunglasses, security glasses, or welding masks) [bold]or a [color=cyan]mindshield implant[/color].[/bold]
## Regular Revolutionaries A [color=red]Revolutionary[/color] (indicated by a red R) is a crewmember converted by a [color=#5e9cff]Head Revolutionary[/color] (indicated by a blue R). They [bold]cannot convert others[/bold] themselves, but their loyalty and numbers are the lifeblood of the movement.
[bold][color=red]Revolutionaries[/color] are expected to follow the orders of the Head Revolutionaries.[/bold] Acting independently weakens the cause, teamwork and coordination win revolutions. Whether it’s subduing command and security, protecting a Headrev, or gathering resources, your strength comes from working together.
## Mindshield Implants
[color=cyan]Mindshield implants[/color] are your greatest obstacle. They will: - Prevent conversion into a [color=red]Revolutionary[/color] - Deconvert existing revolutionaries - [bold]Visibly be destroyed upon being implanted into a [color=#5e9cff]Head Revolutionary[/color][/bold], giving you away - NOT protect against flash disorientation
Assume all of [color=#cb0000]Security[/color] and [color=#1b67a5]Command[/color] are implanted with mindshields already, [bold]however they can be removed using an implant extractor, obtainable from the Medical department's MedFab.[/bold]
### How to Remove Mindshields 1. Craft an [color=cyan]implant extractor[/color] at a [bold]Medical TechFab[/bold] (5 steel, 5 glass).
2. Subdue your target (stun, cuff, or otherwise restrain them).
3. Use the extractor to remove their implant [italic](ensure the implanter is set to extract mindshields).[/italic]
4. Take away any flash protection they have.
5. Flash them in [color=red]harm mode[/color] to convert.
[color=red][bold]Beware:[/bold][/color] Removing mindshields is risky, those with the security hud are able to see who is and isn't mindshielded. If Security notices a command or security member without a mindshield, it will instantly out them as being a revolutionary.
### Tips for Converting Command/Security - [bold]Coordinate[/bold] ambushes with other revolutionaries. - [bold]Involve[/bold] converted medical staff to produce implant extractors. - If conversion isn’t possible, [bold]restraining[/bold] or [bold]eliminating[/bold] the target is a last resort.
